member.name: ISpatialAudioMetadataItemsBuffer.AttachToBuffer
member.summary: Attaches caller-provided memory for storage of objects.
member.param: A pointer to memory to use for storage.
The length of the supplied buffer. This size must match the length required for the metadata format and maximum metadata item count.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The has not been opened for copying with a call to or the object has been closed for writing with a call to .
The was created to use a media pipeline internal buffer, so an external buffer can't be attached.
The supplied buffer has already been attached.

One of the provided pointers is not valid.
The supplied buffer is not large enough to hold the maximum number of metadata items.

member.name: ISpatialAudioMetadataItemsBuffer.AttachToPopulatedBuffer
member.summary: Attaches a previously populated buffer for storage of objects. The metadata items already in the buffer are retained.
member.param: A pointer to memory to use for storage.
The length of the supplied buffer. This size must match the length required for the metadata format and maximum metadata item count.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The has not been opened for copying with a call to or the object has been closed for writing with a call to .
The supplied buffer has already been attached.
The was created to use a media pipeline internal buffer, so an external buffer can't be attached.
The supplied populated buffer uses a format that is different from the current format.

One of the provided pointers is not valid.
The supplied buffer is not large enough to hold the maximum number of metadata items. Call to determine the required buffer size.

member.name: ISpatialAudioMetadataItemsBuffer.DetachBuffer
member.summary: Detaches the buffer. Memory can only be attached to a single metadata item at a time.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The has not been opened for copying with a call to or the object has been closed for writing with a call to .
The was created to use a media pipeline internal buffer which can't be detached.
The supplied buffer is not attached.

One of the provided pointers is not valid.
The supplied buffer is not large enough to hold the maximum number of metadata items.

summary.para: Provides methods for attaching buffers to for in-place storage of data. Get an instance of this object by passing a pointer to the interface into . The buffer will be associated with the returned SpatialAudioMetadataItems. This interface allows you to attach a buffer and reset its contents to the empty set of metadata items or attach a previously-populated buffer and retain the data stored in the buffer.
This interface is a part of Windows Sonic, Microsoft’s audio platform for more immersive audio which includes integrated spatial sound on Xbox and Windows.
